message: to be sure it may be a bit bumpy for the first few that try - but that will be the best way to figure out where the friction is to remove

We are trying to get back to Packaginator this week to architect some things to make it easy to handle things like a 'Haskell Packages' without ruining your ability to accept upstream patches. @jamespaxi
So I'm going to ask people to wait so they don't make it impossible for themselves to migrate forward when we have those big architecture changes.
so personally I understand that if I try - the first attempt is likely to be a throw away effort. But might generate good feedback for packaginator
Great collaboration, guys, way to go.
Sounds good to me. Good luck!

Funny, I was going to ping @pydanny a few weeks ago about what it would take to _genericize_ django-packages for other uses (with vim plugins in mind) and now we already have packaginator and someone working on using it for vim plugins. What a world!
I'm going to hammer out the new package architecture this weekend in a solo effort. Then toss it up in a branch for debate. Comments from @unbracketed and @ptone and others would be nice.
i'm planning a Haskell library site! Need to get a lot of work out of the way this week...  :)
@jamespaxi Quite interesting that you mention Haskell. That explains the style of your pull requests in Packaginator.
@pydanny - is this (package architecture) branch up somewhere for perusal?
BTW - I haven't yet, but will be looking to use this in an intranet site for a mix of python, and statistical packages (R, stata, etc.).
Not yet @yarkot. Will hopefully get to it this weekend.
